import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
%matplotlib inline

import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')
source.162f480d:
from nltk.tokenize import word_tokenize
from nltk.corpus import stopwords
from string import punctuation
import string

list_stopwords = set(stopwords.words('english'))

from wordcloud import WordCloud
source.1435c29a:
df_nlp['title2'] = df_nlp['title'].str.lower()
df_nlp['title2'] = df_nlp['title2'].apply(word_tokenize)
df_nlp['title2'] = df_nlp['title2'].apply(lambda x: [word for word in x if word not in list_stopwords])
df_nlp['title2'] = df_nlp['title2'].apply(lambda x : [word.translate(str.maketrans('', '', string.punctuation)) for word in x])
df_nlp['title2'] = df_nlp['title2'].apply(lambda x : [word for word in x if len(word) > 1])
source.4e9afbf5:
text1 = df_nlp['title2']
wordcloud = WordCloud(
    width = 1500,
    height = 1000,
    background_color = 'black',
    stopwords = list_stopwords).generate(str(text1))
fig = plt.figure(
    figsize = (10, 8),
    facecolor = 'k',
    edgecolor = 'k')
plt.imshow(wordcloud, interpolation = 'bilinear')
plt.axis('off')
plt.tight_layout(pad=0)
plt.show()
source.e93fd841: * I created new features 'brand' and 'features1' in df.
source.91af44a3:
Insight

I found 3 clusters from data. Mapping by PCA and cluster map by PCA is
![image.png](attachment:d2790ba8-047d-4fb3-baf4-d8c68adc6b10.png)

907 items out of 1,000 are in cluster 0. 17 items are in cluster 1 and 76 items are in cluster 2. Most items are in cluster 0 and cluster 0 covers wide range in 'avg_rating', 'selling_price' and 'MRP'. There are some gap in 'num_of_ratings' between clusters. Cluster 1 is the most, cluster 2 is the second and cluster 0 is the least. So PCA 1 seems to have a strong correlation with 'num_of_rating'. One of hypothesis is that items in cluster 1 have high royalty customers. It means that it is important for comapnies how they can maintain and grow good relationship with high royalty customers.
